SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

gov.nih.nlm.meme.server
Class Version

java.lang.Object
  gov.nih.nlm.meme.server.Version
public class Version
extends Object

The Version class provides package version information for gov.nih.nlm.meme.server package. History

08/15/2005
Suppressible implementation.
06/17/2005
Improved MappingService. ReportsGenerator now supports additional parameters for URLs in HTML style reports.
03/25/2005
ThreadPool handles more exceptional cases, allowing *
ThreadPool handles more exceptional cases, allowing the thread to return to the pool. HTTPRequestListener better reports rejected requests. SessionTimeoutThread now runs the garbage collector once per minute and writes the total free server memory to the log once per five minutes. InsertionService has upgrades, not important here.
03/11/2005
ReportsGenerator correctly handles action reports using new model for undo. New InsertionService.
01/25/2005
*
SessionContext tracks latest request. HTTPRequestListener sets request_id for reconnect requests. MEMEApplicationServer supports a new special type of request for reconnecting a current client call with a previous request. This is to assist in recovering from network failures.
01/14/2005
ActionSequences uses getInverseAction to undo molecular actions. ActionService supports passing work_id from batch/macro actions through to MBA procedures. Also supports force undo/redo of molecular actions and generic undo/redo of any logged action. AuxiliaryDataService uses objects instead of identifiers when making calls to get activity logs and errors for transactions and work logs. MaintenanceService supports more functions, and a work_id parameter for assign cui actions. ReportsGenerator will show SAB for definitions and SOS attributes. Also, now reports CONTEXT attributes below RELATIONSHIPS.
12/13/2004
ActionService supports getting WorkLog objects by type. AdminService supports get/set operations for system status info. AuxiliaryDataService supports setTermgroup. MaintenanceService supports a variety of maintenance tasks from running queries or scripts to assigning CUIs or running the matrix initiailzer. This should eventually support all of the $MEME_HOME/bin/ scripts. ReportsGenerator support concept level definitions and SOS attributes, and better support for foreign MUIs.
11/05/2004
Minor documentation changes. Services updated where needed to use new action model. MEMERelaEditorService has new method for inserting RELA that includes rank info. ActionService supports accessing of work and activity logs. ConceptMappingService supports new methods for adding/removing MRCUI entries. AuxiliaryDataService supports new methods for editing Sources, Termgroups, Editor information, Languages, and semantic types. ReportsGenerator has minor fix to deal with "missing MUI" issue.
09/19/2004
FinderService does a better job with words that norm to nothing. ContentViewService updated to new data model. New service: ConceptMappingService. HTTPRequestListener buffers input/output with bigger buffer and has improved javadoc. MEMEApplicationServer does a better job of handling data sources when sessions are terminated.
07/20/2004
ContentViewService supports the setContentView function.
07/09/2004
New ContentViewService for managing content view changes.
06/14/2004
ReportsGenerator supports concept level DEFINITION and SOS attributes. RxNormService fixes a bug that allowed dummy SCD names to be added as RxNorm graphs. CoreDataService now supports the client side get inverse relationship function. ActivityMonitor should track performance statistics in milliseconds instead of seconds.
05/06/2004
CoreDataService and ReportsGenerator now support explicitly including or excluding a list of languages. Minor changes to FinderService and ActivityMonitor to handle exceptions from MEME server based on bad parameter passing.
04/19/2004
FinderService supports searches based on releasability.
04/19/2004
CoreDataService now supports reading/not reading non-ENG atoms. ReportsGenerator now supports reading/not reading non-ENG atoms for report purposes. ActionService now uses passed in transaction id and work id values. ThreadPool errors now not fatal. RxNormService no longer handles its own errors and its errors are now not fatal. ActionSequences no longer handles its own errors and its errors are now not fatal.
03/17/2004
Undo and redo operations now support authorities (instead of null authority). RxNormService now finds ingredients based on case insensitive strings instead of case sensitive ones. Finally, ActivityMonitor makes use of sort area size and hash area size. RxNormService bug fix.
02/19/2004
MergeEngineService now handles molecule_id and work_id better. Small bug fix ReportsGenerator.
02/06/2004
RxNormService now handles StaleDataException better. CoreDataService extended to support new client functions. Of particular interest is the ability to read relationships and context relationships in pieces instead of all at once. HTTPRequestListener does not reuse serializer objects, it also provides better handling of exceptions that are difficult to serialize and user passwords will not appear in the log anymore upon authentication requests.
01/20/2004
MEMEApplicationServer first checks that context object is not null (in processRequest) before attempting to synchronize on it.
12/29/2003
MergeEngineService uses progress mechanism.
12/19/2003
MIDDataSourcePool compares data source names in lowercase when deciding if a data source is returnable.
12/16/2003
In response to an error about not being able to read the username of a data source, we fixed a final problem that occurrs when a session is manually terminated. Because the SessionContext.terminateSession method was not setting the session data source to null, it was allowing the data source to be closed, and then later accessed (thus causing the problem). RxNormService was also updated to properly handle the ingredient level relationships allowing an editor to simply change a precise ingredient without leaving duplicate rels laying around. ReportsGenerator now supports a restriction on the number of reviewed relationships shown (requested by TPW) .
12/15/2003
ReportsGenerator has improved code for generating action documnts. MappingService is now implemented and tested. RxNormService better manages ingredient-level relationships. SessionContext now tracks requests and data-sources in a thread-specific way, but still supports the notion of a context using the same data source connection across non-simultaneous requests. MEMEApplicationServer was updated to make use of the new SessionContext architecture. These changes should allow the server to be completely thread-safe, allowing many requests to all access the server using the same session_id without any problems.
12/04/2003
Small change to MEMEApplicationServer to avoid a potential null pointer exception, and another change to make it use ExpiredSessionException. Fix to Statistics so that when the SessionTimeoutThread terminates a session, the requests can be properly found without throwing null pointer exceptions.
12/01/2003
ActionService passes back more information to the client, namely the molecule_id. Also the undo/redo procedures were updated to perform better if the action to undo/redo is null. ActionSequences was fixed, recent changes to molecular actions broke it. CoreDataService now provides access to dead information. MEMEApplicationServer was updated to allow multiple requests to be processed under the same session at the same time, this included additions to rework how the session removes the request object when processing is finished. Before, the "current request" was saved as part of the "session context" object, which meant that if two requests with the same session id entered the system at the same time, there would be contention for setting the "current request" variable. This was fixed by saving all requests in the session context hashmap and keying it on Thread.currentThread(). SessionContext was updated to reflect these changes, as well as supporting -1 as a timeout value meaning "no timeout".
11/07/2003
MEMEApplicationServer and HTTPRequestListener now include authentication information in error messages, so it should be easier to see what editor is having a problem. ActionService returns the molecule_id to the action client.
10/22/2003
A bug in RxNormService was allowing duplicate components under just the right circumstances. This was fixed.
10/22/2003
ReportsGenerator shows SNOMEDCT concept status.
10/15/2003
HTTPRequestListener does a better job of reporting unexpected exceptions, and it no longer sends email on "broken pipe" exceptions. MEMEApplicationServer handles the case where a session changes to a new data source in which case the old one should be returned. We also handle the case where an exception occurs while handling a request with an active session; this was fixed to prevent the data source from being prematurely returned to the pool.
10/01/2003
ReportsGenerator had a minor change to the DEF and SOS sections, an extra line break was added.
09/23/2003
HTTPRequestListener was changed to better handle exceptions, but one cost is that it no longer emails when errors occur. This was fixed. ActionService was upgraded to pass back a violations vector upon a molecular "do".
09/05/2003
RxNormService was not populating rx norm atoms before removing them in the removeGraph method. This caused a problem with the RxNorm editor "Apply To Concept" functionality. The problem was fixed by always populating the atom before removing the graph. Also, LEXICAL_TAG attributes should be inserted as releasable if the value is TRD. ReportsGenerator only uses &nbsp; if there is more than one space.
08/25/2003
ReportsGenerator was changed to no longer print the leading spaces before concept ids in the relationships section (for HTML reports). a better solution will be sought.
08/19/2003
MergeEngineService strips off the ENG- when inserting demotions for a MID merging set. RxNormService includes a small bug fix to the only change to a graph to be an addition of an SY where one was missing. ReportsGenerator no longer generates concept reports with 
 tags, instead it uses a monospace type with   characters
         to allow line wrapping in the reports.
         ActionService and MIDDataSourcePool now support
         the ability to switch the "default" mid. Either an actual db or
         a mid service may be specified.
08/11/2003
RxNormService had a bug fix relating to the precise ingredients being inserted into the wrong concept. ReportsGenerator now produces ActionReport objects, and it includes legacy SNOMEDID and CTV3ID codes on the reports.
08/01/2003
ReportsGenerator was updated to show relationships as unreleasable if the atoms they are connected to are unreleasable. A bug in the getActionReport method was also fixed allowing action reports for things like the INSERT action of a relationship that is now deleted to still work properly. RxNormService was upgraded to support the SBDF and SCDF atoms. Additionally, we rewrote the applyChanges method to streamline the operation, and we extended what is allowed to appear on the RxNorm editor worklist frame to include unreleasable atoms and NLM02/OCD and NLM02/OBD atoms. Since "hide unconnected CDs" is available, there is no risk of too many things being on the worklist. RxNormService also handles the case of an NLM02/SY having a dose form different from its NLM02/SBD without failing.
07/16/2003
Minor changes to ReportsGenerator. Better use of date formats in AdminService for transaction logs. RxNormService has a couple of bug fixes to parseInt "" as 0, and also apply to concept really gets rid of EVERYTHING that's gov.nih.nlm.meme.common.RxNormAtom.
06/19/2003
AdminClient looks up the concept ids involved in a molecular action when generating a transaction log report. RxNormService will remove unreleasable normal forms (and their graphs) when "apply to concept" is used. Additionally the ingredient lookup routines ensure that graphs are connected to NLM02 owned ingredient atoms (NLM02/IN,NLM02/BN) which match the string of the highest ranking non-MTH/MM,TM atom in the concept. ActionService reports more information about ids of newly inserted data back to the client so it is available for use by the editing interface.
06/06/2003
AuxiliaryDataService supports better access to integrity system objects. HTTPRequestListener passes the request a reference to the socket writer, for services like AdminService which can shutdown the server. AdminService supports a kill server function that does not wait for threads to finish running. ServerToolkit was upgraded to support the AdminService changes. SessionContext no longer tracks the socket writer, now it is tracked by the request object. RxNormService looks up NLM02 only ingredients, and NLM02 only brand names. ReportsGenerator now returns a sensible message if getActionReport is passed a bogus id. ActionSequences updated to reflect progress correctly in sequence 2, and the log produced shows concept ids for the actions performed. ActionService reports transaction ids better for batch actions.
05/21/2003
ReportsGenerator was updated to show the sources of both atoms involved in a LEXICAL_RELATIONSHIP. Any services that handle CGI style requests now report HTTP "Expires" headers to prevent clients from cacheing data inappropriately. These include: ActivityMonitor, AdminService, CGIShutdownServer. RxNormService always returns worklist data for a CD atom, even if there is a problem reading the SCD subgraph. ActionSequences now record progress information.
05/16/2003
MergeEngineService sets released when inserting demotions. ReportsGenerator shows the source of both atoms involved in lexical relationships. RxNormService no longer creates atoms with E-XXX sources instead it uses NLM02. ActivityMonitor builds "by source" graphs for "for count" and "for time" graphs. It also returns an image indicating that no data is available for queries without data. ActionSequences was reorganized and enabled with progress information. HTTPRequestListener deals better with unexpected exceptions and also handles CGI style requests with session ids better. AdminService supports additional functions to redirect to a progress image.
05/08/2003
MEMERelaEditorService was upgraded to support sg_ids in the core tables. RxNormService was upgraded to make reads of worklists faster. MergeEngineService no longer directly supports retrieval of logs, that was handed off to AdminService. HTTPRequestListener reports better error messages when unexpected errors occur. AdminService supports "server log", "session log" and "transaction log" retrieval. ActivityMonitor supports a much richer set of graphs. AuxiliaryDataService lets you retrieve all integrity vectors instead of just named ones (this is for a future webapp for editing integrity checks}.
04/25/2003
HTTPRequestListener now preserves the original exception type instead of sending back ClientExceptions. Also, we improved the handling of CGI style arguments and cause any exception while reading the input document to be properly logged. ActivityMonitor now supports a wide variety of graphs. ActionSequences was re-written as a MEMEServiceRequest. This will be part of a future db performance testing suite.
04/09/2003
RxNormService was upgraded to support the client-side iterator methods. In particular, worklists can now be read in pieces, whether from a concept or a named worklist. This allows more efficient access to the worklists. HTTPRequestListener allows CGI-sytle arguments to have just "name=" with a blank value. This is useful when you want to select the default data source. ActivityMonitor was added, currently it just generates graphs of editor activity by month, although is envisioned as the component which will monitor MID performance. The CoreDataService supports the client side populateContextRelationships functionality. ActionService feeds back the target identifier from molecular actions performed, thus allowing the client to recover the target of a split.
04/01/2003
RxNormService supports reading partial worklists (this enables the iterator worklist access provided by the clinet). CoreDataService supports the new CoreDataClient API. HTTPRequestListener now supports GET style requests as well as POST style requests. The Writer is no longer passed to the MEMEApplicationServer processRequest method, instead, an ouptut stream is directly passed to the request if it is a cgi-style request. This precipitated a minor change in CGIShutdownServer. These last few changes were to support the server's ability to directly return image files in response to requests from web browsers, to enable interactive graphs of server and MID activity.
03/19/2003
Change to ReportsGenerator to show RX_NORM_STATUS values as they appear instead of translating them (e.g. U instead of Underspecified). Optimizations to RxNormService and bug fix for "Apply to Concept" functionality. ActionService code for "Approve Concept" was added to support stamping. It also creates a log compatable with the old-style mproc_change_status.pl script.
03/05/2003
Bug fix to MEMERelaEditorService to repair a deadlock problem. Fix to CoreDataService to use a full ticket when reading concept information. Vlad had a hack for this in his code. ActionService was upgraded to support "batch" and "macro" actions through the client. MEMEApplicationServer and MEMEApplicationService now support the notion of "reentrant" applications that can have only one instantiation running at a given time. The actual implementation must be handled bye the service itself through isRunning and isReentrant methods. MergeEngineService was more fully tested and is considered ready for use in a test-insertion environment. ReportsGenerator bug fixes. RxNormService upgrades. In particular to support an "Apply to concept" function that cleans up all unconnected/bad SCDs, instead of just the ones on the worklist.
01/13/2003:
The WorklistService and AdminService were updated to support functionality required by the action harvester and admin applications. The RxNormService was updated to support additional RxNorm functionality, specifically with respect to maintaining branded RxNorm graphs.
11/13/2002:
The ReportsGenerator was upgraded to contain support for the action harvester. Specifically it has methods to generate a simple action report for a molecule_id, and support to generate a summary editing report by calling $MEME_HOME/bin/editing.csh. Significant upgrades to FinderService were also made to provide the ability to explore the action logs. Functions for finding molecular/atomic actions were added. Much of the support for this functionality is implmented in the sql package. Minor bugs in the session handling code were also fixed.
08/28/2002:
HTTPRequestListener uses a SO_TIMEOUT setting of one hour to avoid problems with accept(). If no requests are made within an hour, the accept() call is interrupted and re-started. Most of the development focused on the RxNorm editing API RxNormService and the various services for supporting client side editing. These include: ActionService, AuxiliaryDataService CoreDataService, FinderService, WorklistService. There were modifications and refinement to some other services as well.
06/20/2002:
ReportsGenerator uses real source values for C level rels instead of just MTH. This is to support showing of NLM03 for Vladimir's purposes. HTTPRequestListener ensures that server-side exceptions do not attempt to inform the user (and thus require input from the server side). This improves stability of the server during error handling.
5/13/2002:
HTTPRequestListener was using the same instance of the serializer across different threads. The serializer was moved into the request handler class so that each thread has access to its own serializer. MEMERelaEditorService was upgraded to support manipulation of relationships between atom_ids, CUIs, and concept_ids.
4/22/2002:
ReportsGenerator was fixed in a few ways. (a). logic for when to show context relationships was corrected, (b). STY display was fixed, (c.) status N stys were not showing up, this was fixed, (d) hyperlinks on concept_ids should have #report appended to them, (e) HTML character entities <, > and & are used instead of the actual characters in the report so that everything works out. New service: AuxiliaryDataService. It provides access to data source data.
04/04/2002:
MEMERelaEditorService was made thread safe in response to a database hanging problem. It was also updated to ensure that all statement handles are explicitly closed. ReportsGenerator was incorrectly handling STY, DEF, and SOS sections of the report.
03/26/2002:
MEMERelaEditorService was extended to support the MEMERelaEditorKit.insertRelationshipAttribute(String,String) functionality.

ReportsGenerator was extended to support all of the xreports.pl and ReportsClient options.

The ServerThread API was created to represent bootstrap classes that run in separate threads after initialization.

Some MEMEApplicationServer functionality was made protected instead of private so that the MRDApplicationServer can override it.

DataSourcePool became MIDDataSourcePool. This was to support an MRDDataSourcePool on the gov.nih.nlm.mrd side of things.

SessionTimeoutThread was written as a means to retire active sessions. It is not currently used, though.

11/01/2001:
1st Release.

Author:
MEME Group
